Our Impact

Our Programs

Responsive support services designed to bridge the gap between crisis and stability.

Crisis to HOPE Fund

Immediate financial assistance for critical needs—work, shelter, medical care, and transportation. Includes up to 6 hours of dedicated case management.

Apply for Assistance

"Infusing HOPE in times of crisis through flexible, immediate response."

  • Work Permit Help (EAD)
  • Court Letters & Fees
  • Pro Se Asylum Support

Pathways to HOPE (Legal)

Virtual and in-person pro se asylum support, translation services, and court fee assistance. We ensure no one is denied the right to file for asylum due to poverty.

HOPE Community Services

Empowering immigrants through community service. Participants gain real-life experience, cultural integration, and workforce readiness skills.

Join a Service Team

Workshops

CPR, First Aid, and Professional Housecleaning certifications.

Workforce Readiness Community Integration

A 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to providing humanitarian aid, housing, and legal support to asylum seekers in Denver.
